titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henry A. Reynolds Brooklyn and Manhattan street name records 1978.042
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:01 +0000.

did.unittitle: Henry A. Reynolds Brooklyn and Manhattan street name records
did.abstract: Henry A. Reynolds was Chief of Company Division in the Hall of Records in Brooklyn. The documents in this collection pertain to street names in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn and in Manhattan with notes of street name changes or alternate names of streets. In addition, the Manhattan document gives a detailed account of "The Great Fire of September 1, 1776" and the destruction caused to lower Manhattan as a result of the fire.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Henry A. Reynolds Brooklyn and Manhattan street name records, 1978.042, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Gertrude and Yvonne Reynolds, 1969.
